item.title: School students walked 18 kms on highway to lodge complaint to Gadwal Collector against Principal
item.description:
<![CDATA[Hyderabad: As many as 124 students of Social Welfare Residential School at Beechupally walked for over 18 kms on the Bangalore national highway and lodged a complaint with Jogulamba-Gadwal district Collector BM Santhosh against the Principal for allegedly harassing and beating them up.
In response to the studentsâ€™ complaint, the Collector asked the Principal to go on leave and appointed a three-member committee to probe into it. Wanaparthy District Educational Officer (DEO) Mohammed Abdul Ghani...]]>
item.author: M Srinivas, About The Author
